revised_title: Comparative Study of Haemolymph Pressures in Barnacles
tldr: This study measures haemolymph pressures in various Australasian barnacles, comparing lepadomorphs and balanomorphs. The results show that lepadomorphs have higher haemolymph pressures than balanomorphs, with maximum pressures being sustainable. The research also discusses the implications of an expansive haemolymph system and low absolute pressures in balanomorph evolution.
